title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 192.3 - Fruiting currant districts
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 192.3 - Fruiting currant districts

State Regulations

The following districts where the growing of plants of the
genus Ribes (currants and gooseberries) for the production of fruit is carried
on extensively, or is a potentially important commercial enterprise, are hereby
designated as fruiting currant districts: (a) All of Cattaraugus, Cayuga, Chautauqua, Columbia, Dutchess, Erie, Nassau, Niagara, Onondaga, Ontario, Orange, Putnam, Rockland, Schuyler, Seneca, Steuben, Suffolk, Tompkins, Westchester and Yates
counties. (b) In Clinton County, all of the Towns of Altona, Beekmantown, Champlain, Chazy, Clinton, Keeseville, Mooers, Peru, Plattsburgh, Rouses Point and Schuyler Falls. (c) In Greene County, all of the Towns of

Athens, Catskill, Coxsackie, Greenville and New Baltimore. (d) In Ulster County, all of the Towns of

Esopus, Gardiner, Kingston, Lloyd, Marbletown, Marlborough, New Paltz, Plattekill, Rosendale, Saugerties, Shawangunk and Ulster. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
192.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
